_header: My right good lord most gentle knight
Subjects: women as speakers/narrators; love letters; lovers absence/separation of
_description: A letter to an absent lord, possibly written as if from his devoted mistress, written by John Paston III — eight stanzas rhyme royal

BLAdd43491.First Lines:
My ryght good lord most knyghtly gentyll knyghtOn to your grace in
                    my most humbyll wyse…
BLAdd43491.Last Lines:
…ffor all gode cher on euyn & on morowWhyche then was mad
                    now tornyth me to sorowe
BLAdd43491.Note:
Robbins  and  Cutler (1965)
